item.title: Andy Warhol @ Christie's: By the Book
item.description:
Andy Warhol @ Christie's: By the Book

Following the traveling exhibition Warhol by the Book this month's sale continues the exploration of Andy Warhol's lifelong interest in publishing and the art of the book, featuring numerous studies for well-known books, such as In the Bottom of My Garden and Wild Raspberries , as well as a rare Lips book.

item.title: Clo'e Floirat, 'You broke my art', 2015, Watermill Center Summer Benefit Auction 2016 | Artsy
item.description:
Clo'e Floirat, 'You broke my art', 2015, Watermill Center Summer Benefit Auction 2016 | Artsy

Clo'e Floirat's charming drawings comment on contemporary cultural events, often with a satirical edge. Her subjects have included the London Olympics, the Battersea Power Station, The Pritzker Architecture Prize, and monumental public art projects by Anish Kapoor, Daniel Buren, and Ilya and Emilia Kabakov.

item.title: Christian Wassmann, '"Dodecahedron" chandelier and optical instrument', 2014, Watermill Center Summer Benefit Auction 2016 | Artsy
item.description:
Christian Wassmann, '"Dodecahedron" chandelier and optical instrument', 2014, Watermill Center Summer Benefit Auction 2016 | Artsy

Architect and designer Christian Wassmann began his career at a young age in Switzerland. Interested in the intersection between the arts and architecture, his currently New York-based practice (housed in his Studio Christian Wassmann) focuses on the interconnections between art forms. The firm's ideology is guided by the design principle "form performs function," rather than the modernist mantra "form follows function."

item.title: An Artist Brings Alive the Worlds Dancing in Her Head
item.description:
An Artist Brings Alive the Worlds Dancing in Her Head

PARIS - Camille Henrot drew obsessively as a girl growing up in Paris. She doodled on the walls of her family's apartment, and scratched up the wooden panels in the elevator. Her mother, an engraver, let her skip school to go to the zoo and sketch the animals there.
